title: Chinese man arm stuck squat toilet entire night trying reach dropped keys
story: A man in central China spent an entire night with his arm stuck in a squat toilet after trying to reach for keys. He called for help for six hours until a neighbour heard him in the morning          A firefighter was seen breaking the porcelain toilet with a large hammer on Sunday morningChinese knife man is sentenced to death after stabbing a...Ouch! Monkey punches curious young girl in the face after...Is this the most scenic highway you've seen? Incredible...Fancy dinner with a view? Daredevil tourists enjoy a luxury...Share this articleVideo footage of the rescue operation in Hubei province shows the man's right arm completely jammed down the toilet. The man, identified as Mr Wang, was seen lying flat on his front, unable to move. He had accidentally dropped his keys in the toilet at about 11pm the night before and attempted to reach for them, but could not get his arm out due to the high pressure inside the tube.          He attempted to reach for his dropped keys, but could not get his arm out due to the high pressure inside the tube. Firefighters spent 30 minutes to free him          The man, identified as Mr Wang, was seen lying flat on his front, unable to moveA firefighter was seen breaking the porcelain with a large hammer and a drill.'Your arm is stuck inside the pipes, yes?' another fireman asked Mr Wang.'Yes - for the whole night,' he replied. 'Can you still feel your arm?''Yes,' he said.After 30 minutes, firefighters freed the man. His arm was red and swollen, according to the report. He was taken to hospital for a checkup.           After 30 minutes, firefighters freed the man. His arm was red and swollen          After being rescued, the man was taken to hospital for a checkupSquat toilets seem to pose a safety hazard in China - getting a body part stuck in the toilet is apparently a common occurrence. A man in south-east China also had his entire arm stuck in a squat toilet when he tried to retrieve his phone in May.Firefighters had to use washing-up liquid to reduce the friction while breaking the porcelain toilet to free the man's arm.In April, a woman got her foot stuck inside a squat toilet after using a public bathroom in Nanning. Firefighters had to use cooking oil to ease her leg out of the contraption.

title: Couple buy favourite beach 250 000
story: Mother-of-six Stephanie Roach and husband Dan have spent every summer holiday at Saundersfoot, west Wales, and have now bought it          The 2.2 acre stretch of golden sands in  Pembrokeshire was put on the market for £250,000The 2.2 acre sandy beach just three miles from the tourist hotspot of Tenby is popular with tourists due to its blue flag status.Adult literacy teacher Stephanie - known as Stevie - said they decided to buy the beach after it went up for sale because they feared it may fall into the wrong hands.She said: 'Our biggest fear was somebody might buy the beach and do something against the ethos of it.'We wanted to preserve the beach as it is and for it to remain family friendly.Gabriel Jesus, Gylfi Sigurdsson, Nemanja Matic and fellow...Inside John and Toni Terry's lavish Surrey mansion: A...Film producer and New York Giants chairman Steve Tisch...Share this article'We'd heard about the sale and I said 'oh gosh, surely other people feel like us, can't we get a group of like-minded people together?''So Dan phoned up and knocked on people's doors and within moments there were five of us.'I've been brought up round here, as has my husband and his brothers and the neighbours who've also come into the consortium.'          Mr Roach first went to Saundersfoot aged two and has been every year since, making new memories with his wife Stephanie (pictured together at the beach) and their six children The couple - who live in Cambrrideshire but have a holiday home in Saundersfoot - joined together with three friends to form a consortium to buy the beach.          Adrian and Nicola Alford (pictured on the sands) decided to sell the plot of land after 10 yearsIt owns the trading rights to the beach and has so far struck deals with two vendors to trade on the beach - a local ice cream van and a stall selling fresh local seafood.But the couple who paid an undisclosed sum for the beach want to protect it rather than exploit the natural beauty.Stevie said: 'We wanted to promote the local businesses that are important to the community.'It's a very vibrant community here, and people look after the beach, and that's what we really want to preserve and enhance.' Previous owners Adrian and Nicola Alford decided to sell the plot of land after 10 years because they wanted to pursue other interests.Adrian, 53, ran the beach for 10 years with his wife Nicola, 51, and son Toby, 29.Estate agents RK Lucas &amp Son say Saundersfoot is one of the most visited tourist destinations in west Wales.          The Pembrokeshire beach, often packed in good weather, has been secured for future generationsAdrian said: 'We cater for families wanting a seaside experience. We sell ice-cream and hot and cold food, run a bouncy castle and rent out sun loungers and deck chairs as well as kayaks, pedalos and stand-up paddle boards.'It is such a beautiful place to work, absolutely stunning. We get beautiful sunrises.'You come down first thing in the morning when there is hardly a soul around and then the crowds slowly build up.'It will be nice to see another couple take it on with the energy and vitality it needs.'

title: Eagle eyed photographer captures big cat hiding amid foliage Kenya it
story: The leopard is one of the world's largest cats, but it is surprisingly difficult to pick out the deadly predator in this photo as it has blended in perfectly with its surroundings          Leopards are covered in a coat of spots which helps to break up the animal's outline and helps it to blend in with the foliage and grasses that it uses for cover while huntingWARNING: Answer below While taking a tour of the reserve Gerlach, who has been photographing animals for more than 40 years, managed to discern the deadly predator despite its best efforts at hiding itself.  Leopards are found across Kenya and, while their numbers have fluctuated in recent years, are not as threatened by poaching or habitat destruction as their relatives such as lions.Despite adults weighing up to 100lbs, leopards are actually the smallest of the big cat species, and most of their hunting tactics are designed to keep them out of the way of their larger cousins.Ouch! Monkey punches curious young girl in the face after...Arachnophobes, look away now! The terrifying moment a giant...Feline intuition: Cats at daycare center run for cover...Share this articleLeopards are solitary animals, unlike lions, and largely hunt at night to avoid competition with the so-called King of the Jungle.Because of their small size they will often drag their quarry up a tree to prevent it being stolen by other predators, which offers a clue as to where this leopard is hiding.They are similar in appearance to jaguars, but are smaller and less muscular. They also lack a dot in the centre of their spots, which is the mark of a jaguar.           The leopard is lazing in the branches of this tree, which is one of the animal's favoured hang-outs, as it keeps it out of the way of much larger predators that patrol the ground below          Even standing up in the tree, the leopard is hard to see (centre). The cats will often drag their prey into trees to stop it being stolen by lions and other large predators          Leopards are relatively common across Kenya but particular concentrations can be found inside the Maasai Mara and Samburu National ReservesIt is unlikely that the two species would be confused in the wild, however, as they do not share a habitat.Leopards live mostly across southern parts of Africa and in scattered communities across Asia, Pakistan and Malaysia, while jaguars live in the Americas.Leopards can be spotted across Kenya but there are particular concentrations in the Maasai Mara and Samburu National Reserves.As with many of Africa's largest predators, their numbers increase dramatically around wildebeest migration season as they follow the herd, hoping to pick off stragglers.Igor Gerlach has been a photographer since 1974 and began taking pictures of wildlife in 1976. He has since won dozens of awards and published hundreds of images, both in books and national newspapers.

title: Lycra clad lout ploughs little girl bike
story: Footage shows the impatient cyclist speeding past a family as they rode past an antiques shop          As the cyclist tries to weave past them, he collides with the youngster's bike, sending her tumbling to the groundThe hit-and-run incident was captured on security cameras outside Grandad's Attic antiques shop in Stourbridge, Worcestershire, on Sunday  at 1pm.Shop owner Dave Powell, 57, said: 'I was inside my shop and I heard some kind of thing going on and a girl crying.Apartment which serves up smashing views of Wimbledon's...The tragedy behind the man who wants to break England¿s...Poundworld will close 25 stores causing the loss of 242 jobs...Number of prisoners using Facebook, YouTube and Instagram...Share this article'I looked out my door, and presumed she had fallen off her bike but then saw her dad come running back towards her and realised that she had been knocked off the bike by an adult.'Her dad had chased after him but then come back to see how his daughter was. He was torn between going after the cyclist and seeing how his daughter was.          The rider then cycles off leaving the girl in tears on the road before her horrified father rushes to comfort her          The hit-and-run incident was captured on security cameras outside Grandad's Attic antiques shop in Stourbridge, Worcestershire          The youngster's father can be seen trying to comfort her as the cyclist flees the scene'There was a group of people gathered. I gave her a drink and a bowl of water and we mopped her wounds. They were just grazes but she was very upset.'There is a bridge and by the side of the bridge there is a little wall, 18 inches high, and mountain bikers think it is clever to hop up onto the wall and hop off the other end.'The family were walking along the wall and as they got to the end he was jumping off. He jumped right into the little girl.'I think part of the problem is that it has got so popular. There are more people cycling on the footpath.'Mr Powell said he understood the family had reported the incident to West Mercia Police.

title: Rare collection set fetch 2 000 auction
story: Pictured: The late John Entwistle – who performed bass, backing and lead vocals from 1964–2002 - pictured with a friend at Charing Cross on May 13, 1966           Signed! Roger Daltrey scrawled his signature on this candid shot of him wearing a floral shirt and on-trend glasses near Charing Cross on May 13, 1966           Fan turned friend: Gaby McGee, pictured right with Roger outside Heathrow in 1967, was a huge supporter of the band but later became pals with them   Rare: The private collection includes a portrait of the late Keith Moon (pictured) who died from a drug overdose at the age of 32          The collection includes a copy of debut album My Generation, signed by the four original band members. Pictured: John at his home in October 1966          Famous friends: This photograph shows Roger Daltrey again in Charing Cross in May 1966           Swinging Sixties: Here John Entwistle chats to friends in Charing Cross in 1966           Empty streets: Road manager Neville sports a pair of now-fashionable tight trousers and a sweatshirt in Charing Cross as the band travelled the city in 1966           Roadies: The Who's road managers Gordon and Neville at Regent's Park in May 1966           Iconic: Among the rare collection is a signed copy of the My Generation album cover           Arrivals: Roger Daltrey pictured with three friends after arriving back at London's Heathrow following his American tour in June 1966 A Royal thank you! The Queen hails the 'tenacity, skill and...Grab a slice of 'Britain's St Tropez': Stunning seaside home...Share this article    Having fun: Bandmates John Entwistle and Keith Moon with a friend at Charing Cross in May 1966  Pictured: Pete Townsend – lead guitar, backing and lead vocals from 1964 to present - photographed at Heathrow in October 1967           Back in London! Peter Townsend dressed smartly for his arrival back in the UK following his second tour of the USA in October 1967           Collection: The items belonged to Gaby McGee, a fan turned friend of Roger Daltrey, and were inherited by her nephew           Off-duty: Here John relaxed at home with his partner in October 1966, after a whirlwind two years of touring with his bandmates           Fooling around: Gaby followed The Who around the country, greeting the band at Heathrow Airport when they returned from their early tours of the USAFrontman Daltrey was supporting The Beatles in 1964 with his former band The High Numbers when he spotted Gaby waiting for an autograph beside the stage doors.Gaby followed The Who around the country, greeting the band at Heathrow Airport when they returned from their early tours of the USA.She even photographed visits to John Entwistle's house and Daltrey's flat in London.Gaby's nephew, Kristian Horne, had the collection valued at Wessex Auction Rooms in Wiltshire.Auctioneer Martin Hughes believes the photos and vinyls will fetch between £1000-£2000 when they go under the hammer on July 13.          Following fan: Gaby even photographed visits to John Entwistle's house in October 1966           Nice ride! Gaby's interest in the band saw her travel the country with them - taking a photograph here of Roger Daltrey's beloved Volvo, parked at Regent's Park in May 1966          Flying high: Gaby greeted the band at Heathrow after their personalised plane (centre) arrived back from tour in April 1967          Gaby's nephew, Kristian Horne, had the collection valued at Wessex Auction Rooms in WiltshireHe said: 'I sat down with the collection to begin cataloging them for our specialist vinyl and music auction.'After I had finished I looked into the bottom of the vintage record case and found a small envelope and when I looked inside I couldn't believe what I found.'There were 21 candid photos of the band taken by the seller's Auntie in various locations in 1966 and 1967 - many of which had been signed by the members of the band.'There is one particular photograph that is just Keith with his signature very clearly written to the front. It's my favourite picture from the collection and he looks so iconic.'To me it's priceless to have such a candid shot signed by the legend himself.'The band's drummer Keith Moon died in 1978 and his autograph is considered a rarity by collectors - as is a collection of all four signatures together.Bids from around the world are expected when they auctioned at Wessex.An ultra rare vinyl demo of The Beatles first single, Love Me Do, will also be available - and is expected to sell for up to £7000.           The items belonged to Gaby McGee, a fan turned friend of Roger Daltrey, and were inherited by her nephew          The band's drummer Keith Moon died in 1978 and his autograph is considered a rarity by collectors - as is a collection of all four signatures together           Frontman Daltrey was supporting The Beatles in 1964 with his former band The High Numbers when he spotted Gaby waiting for an autograph beside the stage doors

title: Prince Charles proudly displays medals RAF centenary service
story: Prince Charles proudly displayed his military medals and breast stars at the Westminster Abbey service today. Pictured: 1) Order of Merit 2) RAF Wings 3) Queen's Service Order, New Zealand, Extra Companion 1983 4) Coronation Medal 1953 5) Silver Jubilee Medal 1977 6) Golden Jubilee Medal 2002 7) Diamond Jubilee Medal 2012 8) Long Service Good Conduct Medal (3x Award Bars) 2016 9) Canadian Forces Decoration (2x2nd Award Bars) 1991 10) The New Zealand Commemorative Medal 1990 11) The New Zealand Armed Forces 2012 12) Order of the Garter (Knight) 13) The Most Ancient and the Most Noble Order of the Thistle (Knight)  Prince Charles, 69, donned military uniform to attend the service with the Duchess of Cornwall'Tenacity, skill and gallantry are your hallmarks': The...Wrapped in the flag! Her Majesty, 92, struggles with the...Is this the 'Sussex sit'? Meghan commits ANOTHER 'royal faux...The Fab Four on parade! Meghan and Kate compete in the style...Share this articleOrder of Merit            Awarded to those who provided outstanding service in the armed forces, or science, art, literature. There can only be a total of 24 members of the OMAwarded to those who provided outstanding service in the armed forces, or science, art, literature. There can only be a total of 24 members of the OM.As with the Royal Victorian Order, the Order of Merit is in the sole gift of the Sovereign but carries no rank apart from the initials OM after the name. The Prince of Wales was awarded the Order of Merit on June 26, 2002. Aircrew badge           The aircrew badge, commonly referred to as 'wings', is the badge worn on the left breast, above any medal ribbons, by qualified aircrewThe aircrew badge, commonly referred to as 'wings', is the badge worn on the left breast, above any medal ribbons, by qualified aircrew. Prince Charles trained as a jet pilot at RAF Cranwell in 1971. He completed his helicopter training three years later.Queen's Service Order          The Order was instituted by the Queen in 1975 on the advice of her New Zealand ministers, and The Prince was installed in 1983The Order was instituted by the Queen in 1975 on the advice of her New Zealand ministers and the Prince was installed in 1983. Coronation Medal           The Queen Elizabeth II Coronation Medal was awarded to the Prince to mark the Queen's coronation in 1953Awarded to the Prince to mark the Queen's coronation in 1953. Silver Jubilee Medal           Awarded to Prince Charles in 1977 to mark his mother's 25-year reign as QueenAwarded to Prince Charles in 1977 to mark his mother's 25-year reign as Queen. Golden Jubilee Medal 2002          Given to the Prince of Wales in 2002 for the Queen's Golden JubileeGiven to the Prince of Wales in 2002 for the Queen's Golden Jubilee.  Diamond Jubilee Medal 2012          To mark 60 the Queen's 60 years on the throne, Prince Charles was given the Diamond Jubilee MedalTo mark the Queen's 60 years on the throne, Prince Charles was given the Diamond Jubilee Medal.Long Service Good Conduct Medal          Awarded to the Prince last year. The medals, which recognise the good conduct of armed forces personnel over a 15-year period, have now been extended to include military officersAwarded to the Prince last year. The medals, which recognise the good conduct of armed forces personnel over a 15-year period, have now been extended to include military officers.They are believed to be the oldest medal still being awarded and can be traced back to 1830.Canadian Forces Decoration           Prince Charles was awarded a second clasp to his Canadian Forces Decoration medal in recognition of his 32 years of honorary service as Colonel In Chief of the Royal Canadian RegimentPrince Charles was awarded a second clasp to his Canadian Forces Decoration medal in recognition of his 32 years of honorary service as Colonel In Chief of the Royal Canadian Regiment.He was first given the medal in 1991. The New Zealand Commemorative Medal           These medals were only awarded in 1990 and marks the Prince's special relationship with New ZealandThese medals were only awarded in 1990 and marks the Prince's special relationship with New Zealand.New Zealand Armed Forces          The New Zealand Armed Forces Award is a circular silver medal. It was given to Prince Charles in 2012The New Zealand Armed Forces Award is a circular silver medal. The obverse bears the crowned effigy of Her Majesty The Queen surrounded by the inscription ELIZABETH II DEI GRATIA REGINA FID. DEF.Prince Charles was given the award in 2012. The Most Notable Order of the Garter (Knight)          The Order of the Garter - formally the Most Noble Order of the Garter - is an order of chivalry founded by Edward III in 1348 and regarded as the most prestigious British order of chivalryThe Order of the Garter - formally the Most Noble Order of the Garter - is an order of chivalry founded by Edward III in 1348 and regarded as the most prestigious British order of chivalry. Appointments are made at the Sovereign's sole discretion. Membership of the Order is limited to the Sovereign, the Prince of Wales, and no more than 24 living members, or Companions. Prince Charles was inducted into the order in 1968.The Most Ancient and the Most Noble Order of the Thistle (Knight)The Most Ancient and Most Noble Order of the Thistle was was founded in 1687 by King James VII of Scotland.The Order consists of the Sovereign and sixteen Knights and Ladies, as well as certain 'extra' knights (members of the British Royal Family and foreign monarchs). The Sovereign alone grants membership of the Order.  Prince Charles was made a member of the Order in 1977.PRINCE WILLIAM   Prince William also had his military medals on display as he stepped out for the service  William wore his RAF 'Wings' above his Jubilee service medals and Order of the Garter star Aircrew badge The aircrew badge, commonly referred to as 'wings', is the badge worn on the left breast, above any medal ribbons, by qualified aircrew. Prince William received his Wings from Prince Charles at the RAF Cranwell air base in Lincolnshire after successfully completing an intensive flying course in 2008. Golden Jubilee Medal and Diamond Jubilee MedalsPrince William also wore the Golden and Diamond Jubilee medals, awarded in 2002 and 2012, respectively..Order of the Garter William was formally appointed by the Queen in a ceremony at St George’s Chapel, Windsor, in 2008. PRINCE HARRY  Prince Harry, who served in the Army, wears his military medals on formal occasions  Harry, 33, wore his Army Air Corps Wings, three medals and a Royal Victorian Order crossRoyal Victorian Order           Prince Harry wears the badge of the Royal Victorian Order on a ribbon around his neck          The royal also wears the breast star of the Royal Victorian Order on his jacket, picturedPrince Harry wears the badge of the Royal Victorian Order on a ribbon around his neck and the breast star on his jacket. The medallion is a Maltese cross with a central cameo featuring the Royal Cypher of Queen Victoria. A blue ring reads VICTORIA, and a Tudor crown sits atop the circle. The RVO is awarded by the monarch to people who have served the Royal family.Prince Harry is a Knight Commander of the Royal Victorian Order, abbreviated to KCVO. Army Air Corps Wings           Prince Harry was presented with his Army Air Corps Wings by his father Prince Charles in 2010Prince Harry was presented with his Army Air Corps Wings by his father Prince Charles in 2010.Afghanistan Campaign Medal, Golden Jubilee Medal, Diamond Jubilee Medal           L-r: Afghanistan Campaign Medal, Golden Jubilee Medal and the Diamond Jubilee MedalLike his brother and father, Prince Harry wore the Queen's Golden Jubilee and Queen's Diamond Jubilee medals. However he also displays an Afghanistan campaign medal, honouring his time served with the Army. Harry was deployed to Helmand between 2007-08 and returned for a 20-week deployment in 2012–13 with the Army Air Corps.

title: Bank England able freeze house prices five years think tank claims
story: The Bank of England should be given expansive new powers to halt house price inflation according to think tank IPPRSkyrocketing house price rises has been one of the defining trends of the UK economy since the 1980s, with a large slice of the economy linked to the property market.While the move may make it easier for first time buyers to get on the property ladder, it would certainly prove controversial, doing damage to the conventional wisdom that investing in property is 'as safe as houses.'It could also prove unpopular with existing owners who feel they have more to gain from their current home rising in value than they do from the price of their next one staying steady. Top places to buy a home in the sun on a budget revealed:...Buyers and sellers 'in stand-off' as Halifax says house...House prices are rising at the slowest pace for five years -...Why building more homes doesn't bring down house pricesShare this articleCan you find a cheaper mortgage? Check the best deal you could apply forMark Hayward the chief executive of Property Mark warned that such a policy could have 'unintended consequences'.'Excessive house price growth is certainly not something we want to see, but homebuyers make purchases on the basis of capital appreciation and the belief that their investment will be protected and enhanced,' he said. 'We encourage all measures to help first-time buyers get onto the housing ladder, but with property transactions at an already low level, this sort of tampering could have unintended consequences.'Mortgage rates have tumbled to record low levels in recent years, with borrowers able to fix for two years at less than 1.5 per cent or five years at just over 2 per cent.While this makes borrowing the large sums needed to match high house prices easier, it also enables values to keep shifting up. For many first-time buyers and prospective home movers the biggest barrier to buying a home is raising a deposit, however.  According to Nationwide's index the average home costs £215,000 - meaning even a 10 per cent deposit is £21,500.

title: Poundland close 25 stores causing loss 242 jobs latest blow High Street
story: Administrators to collapsed discount retailer Poundworld are to close 25 storesBut a memo to staff penned by the professional services firm said: 'As previously advised, the administrators have been preparing contingency plans in the event that we are not able to deliver a sale of the business as a whole.'These plans have been continuing and it is with regret that the administrators have taken the decision to effect an organised wind down of 25 stores, starting today.' Poundworld, which was formerly owned by private equity firm TPG Capital, has 335 stores and employs around 5,100 people. The tragedy behind the man who wants to break England¿s...Number of prisoners using Facebook, YouTube and Instagram...Share this articleDeloitte last week turned down a bid for Poundworld from its founder, Chris Edwards, who was looking to save a raft of stores and safeguard around 3,000 jobs.Daniel Butters and Clare Boardman at Deloitte have already made 100 people redundant at Poundworld's head office in Normanton, West Yorkshire. Yesterday it was revealed that the founder of rival Poundland, Steven Smith, is in early-stage talks about a bid to salvage part of Poundworld out of administration.

title: Russian Embassy pressure delete mocking Novichok tweet
story: The Russian Embassy posted this sarcastic tweet online mocking the idea that Novichok is lethal two days before Dawn Sturgess died after she is thought to have come into contact with the nerve agent. It remained online for two days until MailOnline informed them of complaints  Ms Sturgess, 44, and her partner, Charlie Rowley both fell ill in Amesbury, Wiltshire, on June 30 after it is believed they handled a vessel containing the deadly substanceTwo days before Ms Sturgess's death, when she was fighting for her life in hospital, the Russian Embassy in London's official Twitter account tweeted questioning a Times article which called Novichok 'lethal'.In an apparent reference to two guinea pigs and a cat found and put down in Mr Skripal's home, the embassy tweeted: 'So lethal that 100 g of it fails to kill a guinea pig,' next to a cutting of the article in question.The tweet was posted before Ms Sturgess died, but remained on the embassy's feed for two days after she passed away.Novichok victim Charlie Rowley is now conscious but 'not out...British Novichok victims were exposed to a ¿substantially...Share this articleA number of British Twitter users have questioned why diplomats posted the comment at all.Lawyer Mark Lewis also tweeted the embassy insisting: 'Out of decency you should delete that. It may be a laughing matter to you but three children just lost their mother.'Viv Jones wrote: 'Very insensitive and clearly not true. A woman has died, show some respect.'Clare Kennedy posted: 'This so inhuman given someone has died.'           Scores of people tweeted to the embassy criticising the wisdom of posting such a tweetAnother Twitter user asked: 'Have you literally no decency!?' and another added: 'Please stick to diplomacy &amp integrity. Please try to be objective and professional. Taunts are not productive or funny. Not a good reflection on your good selves.'After being contacted by MailOnline, the Russian Embassy removed the message.A spokesman said: 'Taking into account the sensitivities, we have now deleted this tweet.'The embassy also tweeted: 'We express our sincere condolences to relatives and friends of Dawn Sturgess. We hope the poisoning will be investigated, not manipulated to fit some political frameworks.'Ms Sturgess, 44, and her partner, Charlie Rowley, 45, both fell ill in Amesbury, Wiltshire, on June 30 after it is believed they handled a vessel containing the deadly substance.A Scotland Yard spokesman said: 'The Defence Science and Technology Laboratory at Porton Down confirmed to us on Wednesday, 4 July that Ms Sturgess and her friend had been exposed to Novichok.'          Russian ambassador Alexander Yakovenko has previously been criticised for laughing and smirking during a press conference he gave about the Salisbury nerve agent attackOn Tuesday, her family released a statement through police that said: 'Dawn's death has been devastating for us. Dawn will always be remembered by us as a gentle soul who was generous to a fault.'She would do anything for anybody and those who knew Dawn would know that she would gladly give her last penny to somebody in need.'She had the biggest of hearts and she will be dreadfully missed by both her immediate and wider family.'Mr Rowley remains critically ill in hospital, and Chief Medical Officer Dame Sally Davies has warned everyone in the area not to pick up 'any foreign object which could contain liquid or gel, in the interests of their own safety'.The Russian ambassador to the UK Alexander Yakovenko was previously criticised for laughing and smirking during a press conference about the Salisbury attack. He said: 'We take everything very seriously. For us, it is not a joke.'

title: Largest family 87 year old 346 living descendants including 203 great grandchildren
story: Everybody squeeze in! The Semenyuk family in Ukraine consists of 346 living relatives, with the oldest member 87-year-old Pavel (sat front, holding certificate) and youngest a two-week-old newborn baby          Pavel Semenyuk (centre) is awarded by Ukraine's National Register of Records for having the largest family in the countryThe Semenyuk family lives in the village of Dobroslav in southern Ukrainian Odessa Oblast region.Pavel might have considered himself fortunate to have 13 kids, but now with a total of 127 grandchildren, 203 great-grandchildren and even three great-great-grandchildren, he is being recognised for something truly out of the ordinary.It's all one big happy family, the retired construction worker said, mentioning the only difficulty is remembering all the names of his descendants. More than 2,500 women shed their clothes and e into the...Share this article'I know the names of those who are older. But I often cannot remember the names of the young ones,' Pavel said.Each time one of them gets a family, others build a new house in the village for the newly married pair.To do so, there are no shortage of willing hands as most of Pavel's sons, grandsons and great grandson are also in the construction business.          The Semenyuk family started with construction worker Pavel who had 13 children, before ending up with 127 grandchildren,  203 great-grandchildren and three great-great-grandchildren          Each family occasion is celebrated with an extra-large gathering. The women will cook huge pots of food for birthdays and weddingsReportedly 30 children from the Semenyuk family attend the local school and every birthday and wedding is a big event for the whole family.One of Pavel's daughters Vira Semenyuk, 66, said:'We cook huge pots of food to celebrate our birthdays and weddings. The women always help each other.'          Currently, there are 30 Semenyuk children at the local schoolA few days ago the Semenyuk family were recognised as the largest family in Ukraine. Their names were registered in the local National Register of Records and they are to be submitted to Guinness World Records.The head of the National Register of Records Lana Vetrova said: 'This is a unique family. Until now the world's largest family consisted of 192 members and was registered in India by Guinness World Records.'The Semenyuks have a good chance to break that record.'

title: Astrophysics student took life amid exam stress
story: Student Joel Rees took his own life after suffering from exam stress, an inquest has foundJoel's mother Stephanie Perkin said her son was 'very determined, bright and a determination to succeed'.But he felt pressure over exams a month before he died and walked out of one exam because it was 'too difficult'.She added he had a 'fear of failure' and spent a lot of time working and revising.Joel's father David Rees said his son 'set high standards for himself' but in his first year was 'enjoying life and there were no major issues'.Heartbroken father reveals how his search for his missing...Share this articleHe later got a job in a supermarket deli to support himself and worried he did not have enough time to study.Mr Rees said Joel had emailed lecturers about the 'completely unreasonable' deadlines but was told he could retake exams if needed.He added that his son was 'always independent and would not ask for help', but he would have happily given him money if needed.Fellow student Timothy Pickering told the inquest Joel was depressed and on medication but 'did not want to burden his family'.          Joel's family told a coroner he had walked out of one exam shortly before he was found deadHe said the new drug he was prescribed was 'not really working and made him feel worse'. Devon coroner Philip Spinney heard Joel was found dead, lying clothed on a bed. An autopsy concluded that he died from asphyxiation, suffocation and the inhalation of organic solvents.Mr Spinney recorded a verdict of suicide, adding: 'I am satisfied that Joel took his own life and intended to do so.'It is plain from the evidence that Joel struggled with his mental health over a number of years.'Clearly it is an issue that just does not affect here but across the country there is an increase in mental health issues affecting students in universities and I hope from a tragic event like this that lessons can be learned.'A University of Exeter spokesman said: 'We remain deeply saddened by this tragic case, and our thoughts and sympathies continue to be with Joel's family and friends at this incredibly sad and difficult time.'We encourage all students who are experiencing mental health difficulties of any kind to seek the appropriate support and help, and have robust arrangements in place with local health trusts and services to share information and refer students for the appropriate treatment if it is believed they are at risk.'These arrangements are reviewed regularly to ensure they offer the best possible care and support. The University's Wellbeing Services also offers a broad range of services of students who need support, while we also work to ensure academic tutors are trained to understand the difficulties faced by students experiencing mental health difficulties.' For confidential support call the Samaritans in the UK on 08457 90 90 90, visit a local Samaritans branch or click here for details.

title: Storm Chris bring end Heatwave Britain
story: Sisters Catherine Lingard, eight (left) and Lottie Lingard, two (right) enjoyed an ice cream in the sun as they celebrated Catherine's birthday at Bournemouth beachThis graphic shows the temperature across the country as well as the wind speed, precipitation and air pressure while Storm Chris develops on the other side of the Atlantic. It also shows how the UK compares to other countries on the continent.           Football fan Amy Wray got out and enjoyed the sun and warm weather in Newquay, Cornwall today Met Office spokeswoman Nicola Maxey said while storm Chris will affect the UK, 'we cannot tell what that influence will be at the moment because it is still developing'.There is still 'uncertainty' about the possible track it will take and it would be an ex-hurricane by the weekend when it may hit the UK.Much-needed rain is on the way but it is still too early to write off the summer as warm weather is still expected over the coming week.Apartment which serves up smashing views of Wimbledon's...The tragedy behind the man who wants to break England’s...Poundworld will close 25 stores causing the loss of 242 jobs...Share this articleAverage summer temperatures are 19C (66F) but across the UK we have seen 10C above that, according to Ms Maxey.She said a 'blip' in the current hot weather, which is not down to Chris, is seeing temperatures in the south east drop to around 23-25C (73-77F) and further north to 21-22C (69-71F) in Birmingham or 17-18C (62-64F) in Newcastle but temperatures 'will increase a few degrees to the weekend'.      Meteorologist Aidan McGivern, speaking in a Met Office Facebook post, said: 'Developments on the other side of the pond could very well disrupt weather patterns in the vicinity of the UK.'Tropical storm Chris is predicted to become a hurricane and move north over the next few days.'(By the weekend) Chris is likely to join the jet stream and its remnants are likely to be carried towards the UK. Now, those uncertainties mean there are big differences in the forecast for the start of next week.'One projection showing low pressure just to the west of the UK is bringing wind and rain, but on another Chris is barely there.'One common theme emerging from the start of next week is that low pressure will be a little closer and the weather will turn more changeable than we have seen recently.' Ms Maxey said: 'Certainly next week after ex-hurricane Chris has passed through we are looking at weather that is more mobile or normal (for this time of year) but that is not to say that we will not have another hot spell of weather.'She said that ex-hurricanes like Chris happen regularly. This interactive module, which is continuously updated, represents the picture across the UK. It shows high pressure sweeping across the country creating the warm and pleasant conditions seen over the weekend and into this week. Generated by a super computer and updated every three hours by the National Weather Service, the graph shows winds sweeping across the Atlantic and the Channel.           Sun worshippers enjoyed the heatwave at the beach in Bournemouth, Dorset, making the most of the warm weather as an approaching cold front is forecast to break the sizzling temperatures

title: Gorgeous Princess Charlotte SALUTES RAF
story: Princess Charlotte stole the show today as she saluted the RAF pilots thundering across the skies for the fly-past      Put your princess in a pretty floral dress like Charlotte in Little Alice LondonClick to check it out!The Duchess of Cambridge isn&#39t the only thrifty member of the family. title: Campaigners post hilarious memes joy Jeremy Hunt leaves
story: Dave Harford posted an image of Mr Hunt with the message: 'So that's it. It appears every single person in the NHS has had an early Christmas present - Jeremy Hunt has gone!'          Grant Costello seized upon the news that Jeremy Hunt was leaving the department of health to post a meme celebrating the news           Another Twitter user posted an image of the late actor heath Ledger playing the Batman villain, the Joker, storming down the road in a nurse's outfit as a bridge blows up behind him.          An NHS choir posted a gif of ravers clubbing to express their happiness at the news           Another Twitter user passed his condolences on to the Foreign Office. Jeremy Hunt's time at the Department of Health has been stormy - characterised by strikes and squeezed budgets          Another Twitter user joked that NHS staff would all be celebrating in their corridors at news of the Cabinet reshuffleRoyal wedding and the heatwave give the UK's economy a boost...All friends now! May hails 'productive' first meeting of...Share this articleDave Harford posted an image of Mr Hunt with the message: 'So that's it. It appears every single person in the NHS has had an early Christmas present - Jeremy Hunt has gone!'Merry Christmas NHS.' Another Twitter user posted an image of the late actor heath Ledger playing the Batman villain, the Joker, storming down the road in a nurse's outfit as a bridge blows up behind him.Alongside the image they posted the message: 'Jeremy Hunt leaving the Department of Health and the NHS.' An NHS choir posted a gif of clubbers raving to music with the message: 'The true reaction of NHS staff to the news that Jeremy Hunt is gone.' Alex Smithers posters an image of the character Stewie from the TV show Family Guy looking teary-eyed and standing over a grave clutching a red rose .          Theresa  May (pictured in London today) has swooped to reshuffle her Cabinet after the shock departures of David Davis and Boris Johnson - a double resignation which plunger her Government and premiership into crisis Alongside it was the message: 'I'd like to extend my congratulations to the NHS for surviving Jeremy Hunt.'I'd like to extend my condolences to the FCO (Foreign and Commonwealth Office). It's a tough break but he can't do too much damage. Can he?'Mr Hunt had been Health Secretary since September 2012 - making him Britain's longest serving one ever.But his time in the post was defined by squeezed budgets, escalating waiting times and strikes by NHS unions who warned their staff were struggling to live off their wages after years of stagnant pay.Last year nurses voted to go on strike for the first time ever in protest at their one per cent pay cap.And while Mr Hunt managed to secure a £20billion annual cash boost for the NHS to mark its 60th birthday a few weeks ago, experts warned that far more cash will be needed to maintain services after years of austerity.

title: Queens two senior PR chiefs leave Palace
story: Two of the Queen's top communications chiefs, Sally Osman and Steve Kingstone, are leaving the palace in the coming months, it emerged today          The Queen was today with other senior royals at the celebrations of the RAF centenaryMr Kingstone, a former BBC journalist, became the Queen's Media Secretary in 2016. He will become Director of Communications at Oxfam. It is understood that Ms Osman won't be replaced and a new position, Communications Secretary for the Queen, will include both roles.The departures come after a busy year for the Royal Family's press team, following the challenges surrounding Prince Harry's wedding to Meghan Markle.The Fab Four on parade! Meghan and Kate compete in the style...Finding her royal feet! Meghan puts on a confident display...Share this articleAmid global interest in the wedding, the royals were criticised for failing to properly support Meghan's father, Thomas, who did a deal with paparazzi to take photos of him getting ready for the ceremony.After his deal was exposed, he pulled out of giving Meghan away shortly before the big day, meaning Prince Charles had to step in.Meghan's half-brother and half-sister, Tom and Samantha, also made repeated criticisms of their treatment after they were not invited to the wedding.          The Palace came in for criticism early this year over their handling of Thomas MarkleDespite the difficulties, there is no suggestion the Markle scandals led to the latest changes in the palace communications team.News of the aides departures emerged on a busy day for the royals, who today led national celebrations as the Royal Air Force marked a century since its formation.The Queen, the Prince of Wales and Duchess of Cornwall, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, and the Duke and Duchess of Sussex attended a service at Westminster Abbey this morning.The royals then appeared on the balcony of Buckingham Palace to view a flypast of up to 100 RAF aircraft and a parade of more than 1,000 personnel.

title: Leader Pakistani Islamist group vows wipe Holland face earth
story: Khadim Hussain Rizvi, the leader of the Tehreek Labbaik Pakistan (TLP), vowed to 'wipe Holland off the face of the earth' with a nuclear attackHe was referencing a competition of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad announced by The Freedom Party of Dutch anti-Islam politician Geert Wilders last month.The party said the plan to hold the competition in the party's secure offices in Dutch Parliament had been approved by the Dutch Counter-terrorism Agency NCTV.Wilders' Freedom Party is the leading opposition party in parliament after coming in second place in elections last March.EXCLUSIVE: Radical Islamist preacher who has said he ¿does...Random House axes book by controversial German author who...Share this articleHe has called for the Koran to be banned, and says Islam is a totalitarian faith.'Freedom of speech is threatened, especially for Islam critics,' Wilders said in a statement.'We should never accept that. Freedom of speech is our most important freedom.'          The Freedom Party of Dutch anti-Islam politician Geert Wilders (pictured) announced the competition of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad in JuneAmerican cartoonist Bosch Fawstin, winner of a similar contest in Garland, Texas, in May 2015, has been asked to judge the Dutch contest, which will be held later this year.Earlier in 2015, Islamist gunmen killed 12 people at the Paris offices of the French secularist satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, which had printed cartoons of the Prophet.In 2005, the publication in a Danish newspaper of a dozen cartoons depicting the Prophet led to violent protests across the Muslim world.Meanwhile, the TLP is a political party known for its vehement opposition to changes in Pakistan's blasphemy laws.Last November, more than 2,000 TLP members staged a three-week long sit in at Faizabad – the intersection of the twin cities of Islamabad and Rawalpindi – protesting a small change to the oath taken by parliamentary candidates.It would have seen them say 'I believe' instead of 'I solemnly swear' that Prophet Muhammad is the final prophet.The government ultimately rolled back the change in the Election Act, claiming it had been a clerical error.Pakistan: Give me atom bomb, I'll wipe out Holland: Pakistan's rising Islamist politician Khadim Hussain Rizvi - Times of India

title: Harry Meghan land Dublin embark overseas tour married couple
story: A smiling Duke and Duchess of Sussex arrive at Dublin City Airport for the start of their visit to Dublin, Ireland, at the request of the UK government           The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are greeted by the Taoiseach, Leo Varadkar (right), at Government Buildings during after landing in Ireland this afternoon          The Duchess of Sussex descends the stairs of the private jet that carried her and Harry to Dublin as part of their two-day trip to Ireland           Meghan Duchess of Sussex  shares a laugh with the Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar, right, at government buildings in Dublin       Go green like the Duchess of Sussex in GivenchyGivenchy bottle green pencil skirt and topShop this black version at SsenseIt&#39s been a busy day for The Duchess of Sussex! First she joined the rest of the royal family to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Royal Air Force and now she&#39s touched down in Dublin on her first overseas tour with her husband Prince Harry!Meghan wore a dark navy Dior dress earlier in the day featuring a boat-neck cut, but has now changed into a forest green pencil skirt and matching top.The stylish set is by Givenchy, who are, of course, the label behind Meghan&#39s iconic wedding dress.We love the gorgeous green shade that is very fitting for their visit. The flap-front pockets of the skirt add a stylish detail, and Meghan has accessorised perfectly with tan shoes and a tote by her favourite go-to accessories label, Strathberry.You can shop Meghan&#39s bag in the edit below, plus go green like the Duchess with the super similar pencil skirts from Roland Mouret, Mint &amp Berry, Alexander McQueen and Asos.Roland Mouret &#39Areton&#39 green skirt at SelfridgesMint &amp Berry green pencil skirt at ZalandoAlexander McQueen classic pencil skirt at FarfetchAsos green tulip pencil skirt (now reduced to £12.50)    The Duke and Duchess of Sussex sign the visitor book watched by Taoiseach, Leo Varadkar (right) at Government Buildings during their visit to Dublin          First stop was a meeting with Taoiseach Leo Varadkar who said the couple would be made very welcome in the Irish capital They were then taken to Mr Varadkar's private offices where they were introduced to a number of employees including 18-year-old intern Tabitha Owen, from London, who is on a short summer secondment before starting a PPE degree at Oxford in September.'You're really busy?,' asked Harry. 'What time do you normally knock off? Not until very late? Ah!' Referencing the student's connection to the UK, Mr Varadkar told the couple his 'big sister' worked at Great Ormond Street Hospital.Try not to smirk too much, Boris: Johnson poses for picture...RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Forget David Davis and Boris Johnson —...Up to 70,000 people line The Mall as ONE HUNDRED aircraft...Share this articleDressed in an emerald green Givenchy dress, Meghan seemed more au fait with the agenda than her husband, reminding him that now it was: 'Time to sign the visitors' book.' After briefly discussing who should sign first Harry picked up the fountain pen.Signing simply 'Harry', the Duke joked: 'I never sign big enough.' Then when Meghan - a former calligrapher - signed her name with a flourish, he added: 'Your's is much nicer than mine.'Prince William seems to be holding a laugh during RAF serviceMoment Meghan Markle has legs crossed and corrects herselfPrince Harry and Meghan Markle arrive at Prince Louis' christeningAdorable Princess Charlotte shakes the Archbishop's handPregnant Pippa Middleton arrives at Chapel Royal for christeningI feel fantastic! It was noted that other countries which limit their military activities to peacekeeping have taken part in past.The Duchess told the Taoiseach that she is an honour member of the Philosophical Society in Trinity College.And it was noted that she studied at NWU Chicago where Mr Varadkar’s partner Dr Matt Barrett works at the University Hospital.Prince Harry mentioned on several occasions how much his father, Charles, enjoys visiting Ireland.He also asked about the housing and homelessness crisis facing the country.'The Duke was also very interested in our tech industry and the Duchess has an interest in encouraging women taking up STEM subjects,' the source said.Around 10 minutes later they re-emerged into the Dublin sun with Prince Harry repeatedly saying 'thank you, thank you', as he made his way to a waiting car.Earlier Mr Varadkar said the Royal visit - the first official overseas trip undertaken by the couple since their Windsor wedding last May - was very significant and underlined the importance of Anglo-Irish relations.'I am really looking forward to Prince Harry and Meghan (Markle) coming to Dublin and I think they are going to be made very welcome,' the Taoiseach said. Prince William seems to be holding a laugh during RAF serviceMoment Meghan Markle has legs crossed and corrects herselfPrince Harry and Meghan Markle arrive at Prince Louis' christeningAdorable Princess Charlotte shakes the Archbishop's handPregnant Pippa Middleton arrives at Chapel Royal for christeningI feel fantastic! The royal couple will learn about the history and culture of Ireland, including the famine which drove millions to emigrate across the world           Meghan signing the visitors book after her meeting with Ireland's Taoiseach Leo Vardkar           The couple received a warm welcome from Ireland's Leo Varadkar on a sunny evening in the Irish capital           Meghan sparked a sales frenzy when she sported the Strathberry Midi Tote in burgundy, navy and vanilla for her first official engagement with Harry in Nottingham in December 2017          Meghan gave the brand another boost when she wore its green Strathberry East West mini for her first official visit to Scotland in February          The Duchess carried a tan version of the £475 Strathberry Midi Tote as she met with Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar at government buildings                         The trip has been designed to promote good diplomatic relations with Ireland, with Brexit sure to be high on their agenda. It is the latest in a series of foreign trips the royal family have made to European Union member states in the wake of Britain's impending exit from the bloc.The 'soft diplomacy' the monarchy employs is used to renew and strengthen relationships with countries even as Britain breaks away from the EU.Ireland's Taoiseach Leo Varadkar are formally welcoming the couple  who will enjoy a summer garden party at Glencairn, the official residence of Britain's Ambassador to Ireland Robin Barnett.Prince Harry will speak at the event, where guests will include people from across Ireland's arts, sports, military and social enterprise sectors.          Meghan looked elegant in a Givenchy top and pencil skirt for her first official visit to the Irish capital           The trio chatted about the unseasonably warm weather as the Irish Prime Minister gave the royals a tour of Government Buildings           Meghan previously visited Dublin in 2014 for the One Young World Summit, where she joined a panel discussion on Bridging the Gender Gap                                                    Meghan and Harry will also learn about Ireland's culture and heritage, including a visit to Trinity College where they will see the Book of Kells, one of Ireland's greatest cultural treasures.The duke and duchess will also have a moment for reflection at the Famine Memorial, before visiting EPIC, the Irish Emigration Museum, telling the story of the 10 million Irish who have emigrated across the world.The royal couple will also learn more about the bright future of Ireland during their time in Dublin, with a visit to DogPatch Labs, a co-working space for technology start-ups.Harry and Meghan will meet children and young people taking part in free coding workshops, and will also have the opportunity to talk to female tech entrepreneurs.  A new hairdo for Dublin! Meghan unveils a twist on her go-to style as she arrives in Ireland with a side bun and centre partingBy SIOFRA BRENNAN FOR MAILONLINE She's recently abandoned her beloved messy bun in favour of a more sleek and formal updo, and today the Duchess of Sussex debuted a new twist on the look.Stepping off the place in Dublin for her first official overseas visit with Harry, Meghan showed off a neat side bun with a side parting.It was a departure from the more severe style she's worn on several occasions, with hair swept to the back of her head with her hair parted down the middle.  The Duchess wore her hair in a neat updo with a side parting, lending a less severe look to the formal style. She wore her hair in swept back bun with a centre parting to a reception at Marlborough House in London last week Celebrity hairdresser James Johnson told Femail: 'The changing of a parting can alter your whole style, instantly.'By keeping the side bun low and opposite, she's kept the symmetry in her look. This helps keep the over-style elegant, yet with a slight twist, making the hair a focal point.'By keeping the hair balanced Meghans created a formal, more structured style, ideal for any royal appearance.'Switching up the parting can create more dimension for any look, perfect for a plain outfit like Meghan has on here, giving the whole look more personality.   She ditched the messy bun she used to favour, seen here on a visit to Northern Ireland in March (left). But Meghan did mix things up today with a side parting and side bun The Duchess also showed off her prowess at literal dressing, wearing a top and pencil skirt by Givenchy in forest green, in a nod to the colour closely associated with the Emerald Isle.And she carried a £475 tan tote bag by Strathberry, the small Scottish brand whose designs Meghan has previously caused to sell out.This engagement is likely to be of particular interest to the Duchess, who has been outspoken on the topic of female empowerment.It's been a busy time for the newlyweds who kicked off the week by attending Prince Louis' christening at St James's Palace on Monday.Earlier today, they joined fellow members of the royal family for service to mark 100 years of the RAF at Westminster Abbey, followed by a flypast at Buckingham Palace.  Finding her royal feet! Meghan puts on a confident display on the Buckingham Palace balcony one month after her nervous debut at Trooping the ColourShe's less than two months into her role as the Duchess of Sussex, but today Meghan Markle proved she's finding her feet during celebrations for the RAF Centenary.The former Suits star looked poised and confident as she joined the royal family on the balcony at Buckingham Palace for the flypast, which saw the largest concentration of military aircraft in recent memory form in the skies above London to commemorate the milestone.The Queen, 92, looked up in wonder at the aeronautical display, which celebrated the history of the RAF and featured the return of Second World War aircraft including the Spitfires and Lancaster bombers, and followed a service of thanksgiving at Westminster Abbey earlier today.          The Duchess of Sussex showed off her new confidence today as she stood in pride of place alongside the Queen on the Buckingham Palace balcony for the RAF centenary celebrations           The former Suits star seemed nervous during her Buckingham Palace debut at Trooping the Colour exactly a month ago           Meghan looked at ease as she smiled warmly at her new husband Prince Harry           Prince George, four, and Princess Charlotte, three, were allowed to watch the spectacle from a window of the palace          The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, who yesterday christened their son Louis, appeared in excellent spirits on the balconyShe was joined on the balcony by her sons, Prince Charles and Prince Andrew, the Duchess of Cornwall and the 'Fab Four': The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.But tellingly, it was the Duchess stood in pride of place alongside Her Majesty who is these days usually flanked by one of her sons in the absence of the Duke of Edinburgh.It was a sharp contrast with Meghan's balcony debut at Trooping the Colour exactly one month ago on 10th June, when the retired actress was seen looking to her husband for reassurance and nervously fidgeted with her hair.And she did her best to blend into the background, standing behind the Duchess of Cambridge and sticking close to Harry's side. title: Motorist phone ran Olympic cycling champion Chris Boardmans mother
story: Mr Rosney, of Connah's Quay, North Wales, denies causing her death by dangerous driving, as well as an alternative count of causing death by careless driving          Carol Boardman (pictured, with her grandchildren), 75, was on her pedal bike when she was involved in a collision with a pick-up vehicle in Connah's Quay, North Wales, on July 16 2016Father and son killed when a BMW driving on the wrong side...Indian grad student working in a Kansas City fast food...Share this articleJohn Philpotts, prosecuting, said Mrs Boardman, a keen cyclist, had been hit by the vehicle on a mini-roundabout at the junction of Mold Road and Ffordd Llanarth in Connah's Quay and later died in hospital.          The jury, of seven men and five women, were asked before they were sworn in whether they followed racing cyclist Boardman on social media Mr Philpotts said: 'It's the prosecution case that Liam Rosney had time to see Mrs Boardman and to stop in time to avoid driving over her as he did, but he clearly did neither of those things.'Mr Philpotts told the court phone provider records showed four calls between Mr Rosney and his wife in the run-up to the crash, with the last one terminated four seconds before the crash is calculated to have happened.But the calls did not appear on the log of his phone handset, which was recovered by police from Mrs Rosney, who arrived at the scene after the crash.When Mrs Rosney's phone was seized by police in November 2016, all calls from the date of the collision and before had been deleted from the call log.Mr Philpotts said: 'The prosecution say that this is a case which tragically illustrates the potential extreme danger of using a mobile telephone whilst driving.'As I've told you more than once, Liam Rosney's speed leading up to the collision was perfectly reasonable.'There's no suggestion, I repeat, that he was under the influence of drink or drugs.          Liam and Victoria Rosney appeared in good spirits as they arrived at Mold Magistrates' Court in December last year 'But, he was so distracted by the use of his mobile telephone that he was driving dangerously at the time when Mrs Boardman unfortunately became dismounted from her bicycle.'He added: 'The prosecution say both of these defendants well know the significance of their telephone conversations in the time leading up to the point very shortly before the collision.'They knew it and they deleted the relevant calls from their respective handsets.'Kayleigh Anders, who had witnessed the crash while driving, said Mr Rosney did not seem to realise he had hit Mrs Boardman at first.She said: 'He was looking left and then down, and then left and then down. I think he was on his phone.'She told the court that when he realised what had happened, she heard him say 'she came from nowhere'.The jury, of seven men and five women, were asked before they were sworn in whether they followed racing cyclist Boardman on social media.The trial is expected to last a week.

title: Hollywood hostage actor lost eye nose tongue slit dismembered speaks out
story: Difficult memories: Joseph Capone (above) gave his first interview since he was kidnapped in May 2017 by two men who allegedly 'put out his eye' and dismembered him          Captive: He was pistol whipped and dragged from the home of his actress friend Daisy McCrackin (above) , who was also kidnapped that day and told to get $10,000 ransomCapone detailed how he was at the home of McCrackin on May 3, 2017 when he was pistol-whipped by a man and then dragged off to a car, leaving behind a trail of blood.'He grabbed me by the collar and dragged me outside and dragged me down the driveway and threw me in the back of a car where Daisy was already in the backseat,' said Capone. 'And they put bags over our heads and then proceeded to drive.'He would spend the next 30 hours being tortured by two men, but before that happened Capone said that he began to notice that McCrackin and one of the men charged in the kidnapping, Johntae Jones, seemed to know one another. 'Daisy had known him in some capacity. I'm not sure, but my spidey sense was kind of tingling,' explained Capone. 'It felt weird. It felt like something was off.'Handcuffed Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty to new rape...'Hooyah': Navy SEALs celebrate successful rescue of eight...Share this articleThat claim is also being made by the lawyer representing one of the three iniduals charged in the incident.The attorney for Keith Andre Stewart, who is accused of subjecting to Capone to the 30 hours of beatings, stated over the weekend that McCrackin and Jones had previously been in a relationship while declaring that his client was innocent.Capone said on Monday that he endured another brutal beating when he tried to escape at one point as his kidnappers drove him to a second location. 'I was seen immediately and given another solid beating and thrown back into the bathroom where one gun was put into my mouth,' said Capone. After that was over, he was locked away in a dark and confined space for two days.'They stripped me naked and they threw me in this filthy bathroom with no lights on,' said Capone.He also revealed that the men told him they were not sure what they might have to do to him if McCrackin did not return with ransom.In the end, McCrackin did hand over a check for $10,000, at which point she was taken home by Jones and Amber Neal according to court papers.  Video of Amber Neal's arrest last week went viral, with some saying it was a clear example of excessive forceJones and Stewart were arrested on May 5 soon after Capone was discovered in Jones' Compton ho me according to the LAPD records.It was over a year though until Capone's third captor was arrested by law enforcement.Video of officers from the Los Angeles Police Department swarming Neal last week put the case back in the headlines, going viral amidst accusations of excessive force.The three have now been charged with 17 felony counts, including kidnapping, assault with a firearm, grand theft, mayhem and conspiracy.Neal is also accused of forging a document to claim that she was the owner of the 2011 Lexus belonging to McCrackin that the group had used to drive their victim around the city.  The Los Angeles District Attorney's Office said Stewart and Jones face a maximum possible sentence of life in state prison without the possibility of parole if convicted as charged, while Neal faces up to life in prison.Bail was set at $1 million for Jones and Neal, and $2.08 million for Stewart. They are due in court for a pretrial hearing July 23 at the Foltz Criminal Justice Center county courthouse. Los Angeles kidnap-for-ransom victim defiant in exclusive 'GMA' interview: 'I¿m a survivor' - ABC News

title: Nato leaders create borderless military zone counter Russia
story: Nato allies are expected to sign a 'mobility pledge' at this week's summit, reducing the amount of time it takes troops to cross national borders from 40 days to five (file)          But some ministers are asking that allies go further by creating a completely borderless European zone, allowing troops and tanks to move freelyAnk Bijleveld, the Dutch defence minister who has led calls for the pledge, told The Times that signing an agreement would send a signal that Nato is serious about protecting its borders.   But she is calling for allies to go even further, noting that Vladimir Putin can move his forces wherever he wants simply by giving the order.Mrs Bijleveld eventually wants to create a 'military Schengen' area which tanks and troops could move through unhindered, just as people were supposed to be able to do through a borderless Europe. British Novichok victims were exposed to a ¿substantially...Putin flexes his muscles: How the Red Army has bolstered his...Share this articleBy contrast, Nato commanders must apply weeks in advance for a permit to cross allied nations by land.Juri Luik, the Estonian defence minister, said obtaining permits is not a problem when it comes to training exercises as these are planned long in advance.However, the red tape would badly hinder Nato's ability to respond to a real-time crisis, such as an invasion of Europe by Russia.He said: 'One has to have certainty that your echelons of tanks won't be standing at the border of another ally just to get clearance.'I hope we can sign the mobility pledge. This is very important in crisis time.'          The agreement is due to be signed when leaders of all 27 member countries, including President Trump, meet on Wednesday in Brussels (pictured, the last time they met in 2017)          While current limits work well for training exercises they hinder European countries from responding to real-time threats such as an invasion by Russian troops (pictured)Heads of government or state from the 27 Nato nations will meet in Brussels from Wednesday for a summit that is expected to be dominated by spending.President Trump has repeatedly bemoaned the fact that European nations are failing to meet spending commitments to the alliance, leaving America to pick up the tab.In recent weeks he has also slapped trade tariffs on EU and Canadian steel citing national security concerns, causing friction between allies.Trump will also proceed from the summit straight to a meeting with Putin, as if to underline America's cooling relationship with Nato.That meeting will likely rankle British Prime Minister Theresa May, as the UK has accused Russia of repeatedly carrying out chemical weapons attacks on its soil.On Sunday Dawn Sturgess died after being exposed to Novichok, the same Russian-made nerve agent used to poison the Skripals in Salisbury in March.Sturgess's partner, Charlie Rowley, remains in hospital after also being exposed.Russian double-agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia spent weeks in hospital, most of them in a coma, after being poisoned with the same substance.  Trump's meeting with Putin comes after he also called for Russia to be readmitted to the G7 after it was thrown out over the annexing of Crimea.That move, which came in 2014 after the Moscow-friendly government of Viktor Yanukovych was toppled, is a prime concern for Nato commanders and has seen allied nations boost their presence in eastern Europe. Nervy Nato plans borderless EU for tanks and troops | News | The Times
